Cinnamon Rolls with Cream Cheese Frosting

Time: 2h 30min
Servings: 1 tray
Source
Tags:

Ingredients

Für den Teig

  • 200 ml Milch
  • 50 g Butter
  • 450 g Mehl, bei Bedarf evtl. etwas mehr
  • ½ TL Salz
  • 70 g Zucker
  • 1 Ei(er)
  • 1 Pck. Hefe

Für die Füllung

  • 50 g Butter, weich
  • 130 g Zucker, braun
  • 2 TL Zimt

Für die Glasur

  • 100 g Frischkäse (Mascarpone, philadelphia…)
  • 30 g Butter
  • 100 g Puderzucker, gesiebt
  • 4 Tropfen Vanillearoma

Instructions

Teig und Füllung:
Briefly heat the milk and butter until the butter has melted. First, put 450 g of flour, salt, sugar and egg in a bowl. Make a well in the flour and crumble the yeast into it. Pour the me in and knead everything from the hollow outwards to a smooth dough. If the dough is still too sticky, gradually add just enough flour to make it work well. Cover and let rise in a warm place for 1 hour.
Roll out the dough into a rectangle and brush with the butter. Mix sugar and cinnamon and sprinkle on top, leaving no border. Roll up from the long side and cut into 2 - 3 cm thick slices. Place cut side down in a greased baking dish (such as a casserole dish) and let rise, covered, for another 30 minutes.
Glasur:
Mix all the ingredients for the glaze. If it seems a little too thick, add a little milk - but it should definitely not be too runny. Of course, you can make a regular glaze of milk and powdered sugar if you like, but this one gives the recipe a special kick.
Finish:
Bake the rolls in a preheated oven at 180 °C top/bottom heat for about 15 - 20 min. Spread the glaze on the warm rolls and serve.
Personally, they taste best still warm, but you can also eat them cold.
